Name: Jongmyo Shrine
Description: Jongmyo Shrine - UNESCO World Heritage Site. Royal Confucian shrine dedicated to the spirits of Joseon dynasty kings.

Name: Haeinsa Temple Janggyeong Panjeon
Description: Haeinsa Temple Janggyeong Panjeon - UNESCO World Heritage Site. Repository for the Tripitaka Koreana, the most complete collection of Buddhist texts.

Name: Seokguram Grotto and Bulguksa Temple
Description: Seokguram Grotto and Bulguksa Temple - UNESCO World Heritage Site. Buddhist temple complex with exceptional stone sculptures.

Name: Changdeokgung Palace Complex
Description: Changdeokgung Palace Complex - UNESCO World Heritage Site. Royal palace known for its harmony with nature and beautiful gardens.

Name: Hwaseong Fortress
Description: Hwaseong Fortress - UNESCO World Heritage Site. 18th-century military fortress showcasing Korean architectural innovation.

Name: Gochang
URL: Gochang, Hwasun and Ganghwa Dolmen Sites - UNESCO World Heritage Site. Prehistoric megalithic burial sites from the Bronze Age.

Name: Gyeongju Historic Areas
Description: Gyeongju Historic Areas - UNESCO World Heritage Site. Ancient capital of the Silla Kingdom with temples, tombs, and palaces.

Name: Jeju Volcanic Island and Lava Tubes
Description: Jeju Volcanic Island and Lava Tubes - UNESCO World Heritage Site. Volcanic island with Hallasan Mountain and extensive lava tube systems.

Name: Royal Tombs of the Joseon Dynasty
Description: Royal Tombs of the Joseon Dynasty - UNESCO World Heritage Site. Collection of 40 royal tombs from the Joseon dynasty.

Name: Historic Villages of Korea: Hahoe and Yangdong
Description: Historic Villages of Korea - UNESCO World Heritage Site. Traditional Korean clan villages preserving Joseon dynasty architecture.

Name: Namhansanseong
Description: Namhansanseong - UNESCO World Heritage Site. Mountain fortress serving as emergency capital during the Joseon dynasty.

Name: Baekje Historic Areas
Description: Baekje Historic Areas - UNESCO World Heritage Site. Archaeological sites from the Baekje Kingdom.

Name: Sansa
Latitude: North Gyeongsang, South Chungcheong, South Gyeongsang
URL: Sansa, Buddhist Mountain Monasteries - UNESCO World Heritage Site. Seven ancient Buddhist mountain monasteries.

Name: Seowon
Latitude: North Gyeongsang, South Chungcheong, North Chungcheong
URL: Seowon, Korean Neo-Confucian Academies - UNESCO World Heritage Site. Nine Neo-Confucian academies from the Joseon dynasty.

Name: Getbol
Latitude: South Jeolla, North Jeolla, South Chungcheong
URL: Getbol, Korean Tidal Flats - UNESCO World Heritage Site. Extensive tidal flat ecosystems supporting diverse marine life.

Name: Gaya Tumuli
Description: Gaya Tumuli - UNESCO World Heritage Site. Burial mounds from the Gaya Confederacy.
